summary: This is an email exchange regarding scheduling a witness preparation call for the criminal case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 CR 330). The correspondence is between an AT&T Court Appearance Team representative and an external recipient, discussing availability for a prep call prior to a court appearance.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the defendant in the criminal case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 CR 330), which is the subject of the email scheduling a witness preparation call.

events.title: Email sent regarding witness prep call
events.description: An email was sent by the AT&T Court Appearance Team to an external recipient, inquiring about scheduling a preparation call with a witness prior to their court appearance in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Reply regarding scheduling availability
events.description: A reply email was sent proposing specific times (Tuesday afternoon/evening, Wednesday before 3, or Friday) for the witness preparation call.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning the scheduling of a witness preparation call for the criminal case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 CR 330).
The correspondence involves the AT&T Court Appearance Team, which appears to be providing logistical support for witness appearances.
The email highlights the ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case as of November 2021, specifically the coordination of witness testimony.
The witness's name is noted as being 'located in-' but is not disclosed in the provided text.
